item.description: What is decarbonization? Decarbonization is a strategy to reduce carbon emissions and stabilize planetâ€™s climate. It involves a massive technological transition from traditional fossil-fuels-burning technologies to alternative energy sources. Deep Decarbonization Pathways Project by UNSDSN [http://deepdecarbonization.org/] formulated three pillars of decarbonization: energy efficiency, carbon-free electricity, and electrification. Until proven with detailed technological models on a large scale, the strategy will remain an idea, a belief that economic activity can be decarbonized, i.
